page.title: 04THE BRIDGE
page.content: THE TRONDRA-BURRA BRIDGING SCHEME WAS PLANNED AND BUILT BY THE SHETLAND COUNTY COUNCIL.THE WORKS CONSIST OF ONE BRIDGE (SPANNING FROM THE HOLM OF BROUGH IN LANG SOUND TO BURRA ISLE) IT CONSISTS OF TWIN WELDED CONTINUOUS STEEL PLATED GIRDERS CARRY- ING A REINFORCED CONCRETE DECK ALL SUPPORTED ON REINFORCED CONCRETE PIERS AND ABUTMENTS . THE OVERALL LENGTH IS 500ft,THE WID- TH IS ABOUT 16'7" DEEP.THERE IS A 5ft PAVEMENT ON THE LEFT SIDE AND A 2ft PAVEMENT ON THE RIGHT.THERE ARE HAND- RAILINGS AT THE SIDES , NEXT TO THE PAVEMENTS.THE ROAD HAS A SINGLE LANE, 11ft CARRIAGEWAY. THE BRIDGE WAS OFFICIALLY OPENED ON MONDAY,THE 18th OF OCTOBER,1971 AT 11.30am BY THE HON. GEORGE YOUNGER , T.D.,M.P.,-UNDER SECRATARY OF STATE FOR SCOTLAND.
